trend_summary: Over the period, scattered settlements and roads expand modestly from the central corridor, replacing patches of forest. Agricultural fields enlarge along the southwest river bend, while some interior woodlots thicken through regrowth. No large industrial footprints emerge; landscape remains predominantly natural and low intensity.
notable_changes: Small built-up clusters emerge around the central eastâ€“west axis and near the eastern edge.
New secondary roads and junctions cut through former forest patches, improving connectivity.
Cultivated plots expand along the southwestern floodplain, reducing contiguous woodland.
Interior hill zones show partial forest regrowth where earlier clearings existed.
